page.title: 11Religion in the Claydons
page.content: Steeple Claydon is part of the parish called the{Claydons.}It has 2 other churches in it and they are served by the one{Rector:Robert Hannay. The church of{St.Michael's}is at the top of the village and its steeple dominates the landscape.Its foundation is ancient but the building is not particularly beautiful. The{Methodist Chapel}is in West Street and was built in the 19th century.It is served by a minister from Buckingham.A small proportion of children attend{Sunday School and {Crusaders. The Churches are no longer quite the focus of the village they once were although many people still profess the Christian faith.Some families attend {other denominational churches}in Buckingham.
